data.event: The area along the Goose River that is now Hillsboro was first settled by German and Norwegian settlers around 1870.

event.title: 1880, the present day site of Hillsboro was founded

data.event: In 1880, the present day site of Hillsboro was founded under the name "Comstock".

event.title: was changed to "Hill City" in September 1880

data.event: The name of Comstock was changed to "Hill City" in September 1880 in honor of Mr. Hill.
The city was then renamed "Hillsboro" in 1881 after it was discovered that there was already a "Hill City" in South Dakota.
